result.execSummary:
The defendant James C Lorman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  No opiates, even with a prescription, and defendant must notify doctor of opiate addiction.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  on 15CF749 & 15CF1432.

State indicated Chapter 950 compliant, no additions or corrections to PSI.
Defense had no additions or corrections to PSI.

State recommends further counseling/therapy, 3 years WPS (18 months IC & 18 months ES) & Probation 3 years.
Defense requests probation, any jail time stayed.  

BTC:  on 15CF749:  withheld sentence - Probation 3 years.
No alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
full time employment
Must tell doctor or physician about opoid issue and not allowed to have them for pain medication.
No conditional jail time.
Must comply 100% or be revoked and back to court for sentencing.
If back, not eligible for CIP, but eligible for SAT.
DNA sample
Firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA assment on both.

(Same for 15CF1432)

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, MR. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant James C Lorman in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
